official_title: A Phase II Double-Blinded, Placebo-Controlled Trial of PROstate OligoMETastatic RadiotHErapy With or Without ANdrogen Deprivation Therapy in Oligometastatic Prostate Cancer (NRG Promethean)
brief_title: Testing the Addition of the Drug Relugolix to the Usual Radiation Therapy for Advanced-Stage Prostate Cancer, The NRG Promethean Study
cancer_type_display: A study for patients with castration-sensitive, oligometastatic prostate cancer that has recurred after previous treatment.
cancer_tags: Stage IVB Prostate Cancer AJCC v8
prior_treatments_excluded: Currently on androgen deprivation or anti-androgen therapy

key_inclusion_summary: Pathologically proven diagnosis of prostate adenocarcinoma.
Must have 1-5 oligometastatic lesions identified on a PET scan.
Must have had prior curative-intent treatment to the prostate (either surgery or radiation).
Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of 0-2.
Serum testosterone level of 100 ng/dL or higher.
key_exclusion_summary: Currently receiving androgen deprivation or anti-androgen therapy.
Presence of spinal cord compression, brain, or visceral metastases (lung metastases are allowed).
Prior chemotherapy for prostate cancer or a previous bilateral orchiectomy.
Prior high-dose radiotherapy to a lesion that has now recurred.
Recurrence only in the intrapelvic lymph nodes.
